channel.title: Posts on Gabor Parti
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Gabor Parti

item.title: Nutmeg in the flag of Grenada
item.description: I was drawing flags ever since I was a kid, and all my life I thought that the Grenadian flag has tiny little flame. Now, after spending 3 years on a PhD thesis about spices, I found out that the flag features an open nutmeg fruit (Myristica fragrans), for its important role in the island’s economy.

item.title: The .io Domain Name
item.description: What is the .io domain name and why is it problematic? Link to heading Preferred by tech companies, the .io domain name does not actually refer to the input-output word pair (I/O) we all learned about in primary school. I still remember that IT teacher with the mustache and white lab-coat trying to calm us down when the first Windows 95 PCs arrived… we suddenly got slapped in the face by the ever-accelerating pace of technology and subsequently forgot all our (very limited) MS-DOS skills.

item.title: How to Build and Host a Website with Hugo
item.description: This is a concise, step-by-step guide on how to build a website - just like this one - with Hugo, and host it on Github. Follow the steps and check out the links for further explanation on each component. This guide is made for non-experts, because I found most Hugo tutorials utterly useless and sparse for people new to computers web-development. Table of Contents Link to heading 1. Requirements 2. Building the Website

item.title: How to Publish a Python Package: A Rudimentary Pipeline
item.description: PIPELINE Link to heading This is a concise step by step rough-guide on how to package and publish an open source python project, accompanied by an auto-generated documentation website (readthedocs.io). This post are my own notes for my future self in case I forget how to do this, so the explanations are minimal. If lost, follow the actual tutorials in the footnotes. Sources and links to tutorials on the bottom.
